sub_topic: Determining the connectivity of a graph.
message_1: Consider a graph with 8 vertices and 10 edges. Determine whether the graph is connected or not.
message_2:
To determine whether the graph is connected or not, we can use the fact that a connected graph with n vertices must have at least n-1 edges. In this case, we have 8 vertices, so a connected graph must have at least 8-1 = 7 edges.

Since our graph has 10 edges, which is more than the minimum required edges, it is possible for the graph to be connected. However, having more than the minimum number of edges does not guarantee that the graph is connected.

To determine whether the graph is connected or not, we would need more information about the specific arrangement of the edges and vertices.
